doc.course_introduction: Â—Data repositories in which cases are related to subcases are identified as hierarchical. This course covers the representation schemes of hierarchies and algorithms that enable analysis of hierarchical data, as well as provides opportunities to apply several methods of analysis.
doc.course_chapter: Getting Started//Strings and Sequences//W-Grams and Other Approaches//Time Series//Tree Maps and Hierachies
doc.course_sub_chapter: [['Temporal Analysis', 'Temporal Analysis and Visualization', 'Control Chart Analysis'], ['Introduction to Strings and Sequences', 'Strings and Sequences: Prefix Search', 'Strings and Sequences: Subsequence Search and Suffix Trees', 'Strings and Sequences: Suffix Arrays', 'Strings and Sequences: Subsequence/Pattern Search', 'Strings and Sequences: Approximate Matches', 'Sequence and Time Series: Edit Distance'], ['Data Review', 'Cross-Parsing Distance', 'Compression Distance', 'Filtering', 'W-Grams', 'String Kernels and Min-Sampling Similarity Algorithms'], ['Introduction to Time Series', 'Time Series Modeling', 'Time Series Seasonal Differencing', 'Key Properties of ACF and PACF', 'Seasonal Series Using ACF and PACF 5', 'Time Series Matching', 'Euclidean Distance and Correlation Similarity', 'Issues with Synchronized Measures', 'Edit Distance and Dynamic Time Warping', 'Reducing the Cost of DTW', 'sDTW Algorithm and SAX', 'Time Series Summary', 'Time Series Motifs'], ['Introduction to Trees and Hierarchies', 'Introduction to Tree Maps', 'Tree Map Algorithms', 'What is Hierarchical Data Clustering?', 'Agglomerative Clustering', 'Distance Metrics in Hierarchical Clustering', 'Jupyter Notebooks Demonstration: Dendrograms']]
